newsitem.title: USA: End sought to Lilco's Shoreham surcharge.
newsitem.headline: End sought to Lilco's Shoreham surcharge.

text.p: A bill has been introduced in the New York State Assembly seeking to nullify the four percent rate surcharge granted to Long Island Lighting Co as part of the utility's agreement with the state to not operate the Shoreham nuclear power plant.
In the "memorandum in support of legislation, Republican Assemblyman Gregory R. Becker said the utility no longer needs the surcharge.
"Its stock has been recommended by securities analysts, as the dividend and profits have increased steadily," he explained. Becker is from the Long Island.
"When compounded with (state) taxes, this rate increase is equivalent to a five percent annual increase for 10 years," he said.
